intro: Walteranthus erectus, commonly known as the upright walteranthus, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Walteranthus erectus is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
